snippet: The Motion Picture Academy wants to double its minority membership and achieve gender parity. A close look at its largest group, the actors branch, shows how far it has to go.
abstract: Close look at actors in Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Scientists shows difficult task organization faces in addressing lack of diversity in its membership, focus of scrutiny following controversy over nominees for 2016 Academy Awards; of almost 1,100 acting branch members, about 6 percent are black, less than 4 percent Hispanic and under 2 percent Asian, with women making up around 42 percent of group.

byline.original: By MICHAEL CIEPLY and BROOKS BARNES

lead_paragraph: The Motion Picture Academy wants to double its minority membership and achieve gender parity. A close look at its largest group, the actors branch, shows how far it has to go.

headline.main: Why the Film Academy’s Diversity Push Is Tougher Than It Thinks
headline.print_headline: Diversifying Film Academy Is a Tall Order
